title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: In 2019, the main institutions of the Social Protection System (SPS) will have evidence, tools and capacity to reduce child poverty and social exclusion with the participation of civil society and the private sector., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Economic And Social Policy General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Private Sector Engagement, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, public institutions and civil society actors formulate, implement and evaluate more efficient budgets and effective public policies, oriented to reduce inequalities and guarantee girls, boys and adolescents rights.

participating-org.narrative: WORLD VISION INTERNATIONAL VISION MUNDIAL INTERNACIONAL

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)

description.narrative: General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: In 2019, the main institutions of the Social Protection System (SPS) will have evidence, tools and capacity to reduce childpoverty and social exclusion with the participation of civil society and the private sector.

description.narrative: With UNICEF Colombia&39;s support, the government started to design a multidimensional child poverty index and plan a specific programmatic and policy framework to overcome child poverty. This supported the intersectoral integration of targeting mechanisms and policy objectives, thereby placing the government&39;s commitment to combat child poverty on the public agenda. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/01/2021

(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Child povert data disaggregated by age, geographic location, sex, ethinicity or other relevant categories is available

target.value: 2019:yes (Official reports of national poverty statistics include a specific analysis by age group and child deprivation)

actual.value: 2020:YES (The Government has disaggregated by age and sex on family multidimensional poverty index. There are still no official data on specific measures of child poverty)

title.narrative: Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty, Text

target.value: 2020:yes (National poverty reduction programs are planned and implemented through family and child deprivation)

actual.value: 2020:YES (The National Development Plan 2018-2022 has proposed the creation of a national strategy for overcoming child poverty in addition to a specific measure of multidimensional poverty for children) In partnership with UNICEF, the design of multidimension
